content: cute little bonnet introduction this pattern does not include gauge cute little bonnet is designed to be fully adjustable and intuitive to knit the only fixed measurement is the length across the top of the head from ear to ear the width of the bonnet and the length of the ties can easily be adjusted to suit personal preference i knitted this bonnet using 5 mm needles and nako paris yarn for a similar texture and structure you may substitute with the following yarns drops air sandnes garn kos rowan alpaca soft dk wool and the gang alpachino merino hobbii diablo held single or together with another yarn soft fluffy and lightweight yarns are recommended you can experiment by holding the yarn single or double to achieve your desired fabric and drape cute little bonnet aaaaaknit 1 begin cast on 5 stitches knit until the first tie reaches your desired length i knitted 40 cm increase section row 1 rs knit 1 m1r place marker knit 3 place marker m1l knit 1 row 2 ws purl no increases row 3 rs knit to the marker m1r slip marker k3 slip marker m1l knit the rest row 4 ws purl no increases increase every other row until you have 35 stitches on your needle crown section knit straight until the length matches the measurement across the top of your head from ear to ear markers can be removed while working this section before beginning the decrease section place the markers again as follows knit 16 place marker knit 3 place marker knit 16 decrease section row 1 rs k14 ssk slip marker k3 slip marker k2tog k14 row 2 ws purl no decreases row 3 rs knit until 2 stitches before the marker ssk k3 k2tog knit to end of row row 4 ws purl no decreases repeat this decrease pattern until 5 stitches remain cute little bonnet aaaaaknit 2 finishing knit straight until the second tie measures 40 cm or adjust the length as desired bind off loosely abbreviations & techniques ssk slip slip knit slip two stitches knitwise one at a time insert the left needle into the front loops of both slipped stitches and knit them together k2tog knit two together knit two stitches together as one stitch m1l make one left lift the strand between the needles from front to back with the left needle then knit into the back loop m1r make one right lift the strand between the needles from back to front with the left needle then knit into the front loop best wishes cute little bonnet aaaaaknit 3
